comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Per Wikipedia: "He went into exile, first traveling to Kingston, Jamaica, aboard the German cruiser SMS Dresden.[8] From there, he moved to the UK, then Spain, and arrived in the United States in April 1915." This shot is probably his arrival by ship in New York on April 12, 1915 aboard the Spanish liner Antonio Lopez. Another Bain Collection shot of this group, not yet posted to Flickr, is at www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/cph.3b44080/ A third shot of this scene is at www.flickr.com/photos/elaguila/4001612349/ A New York Times article about the arrival notes that he was accompanied by Jose C. Delgado, his private secretary of 10 years, and Abraham C. (sometmes "Z") Ratner, a business/financial adviser and/or friend and of Huerta. Delgado and Ratner are probably the other men in the photo. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03E2DE153EE033A... On a genealogical site, a descendent of Ratner states: "Hi, Abraham Ratner, who arrived at Ellis Island from Russia in 1894 at age 16 was my grandfather, Abraham Zalko Ratner, b. 1877, St. Petersburg, d. 1919 NY. He is the same Abraham Ratner who arrived in 1897 from Mexico (he had settled in Tampico) and later again in 1904 and 1907 (record says Abraham E, but it was he. He eventually left Mexico in 1914 and went to Spain with exPresident Huerta and then they came to the US in 1915, but there is no Ellis Island record of that." boards.ancestry.com.au/thread.aspx?mv=flat&m=10&p... More details on Ratner's life are found here: www.woolletthistory.co.uk/gedmill/indiI2443.html
